title: Marc Elias
added: In 2020, Elias founded [http://DemocracyDocket.com Democracy Docket], the leading platform for progressive advocacy and information about voting rights, elections, redistricting and democracy. Democracydocket.com shines a spotlight on voter suppression and offers expert opinion on how to fight it in all of its forms. It also provides detailed information about important the many lawsuits that Elias leads.

title: Marc Elias
added: Ahead of the 2020 Election and amid the Coronavirus pandemic, Elias has filed dozens of lawsuits to expand voter access. <ref> https://www.npr.org/2020/09/22/914431067/step-aside-election-2000-this-years-election-may-be-the-most-litigated-yet</ref> <ref> https://newrepublic.com/article/159279/marc-elias-lawyer-democrat-stop-trump-rigging-2020-election</ref> He coined the term “four pillars” <ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/05/27/real-nightmare-scenario-this-falls-elections/ </ref>, referring to four key components to protecting voting by mail: providing prepaid postage, counting mail-in ballots as long as they’re postmarked on or before Election Day; reformed signature matching laws; and allowing local groups to help collect and deliver voted, sealed ballots. <ref> https://www.democracydocket.com/2020/03/safeguard-voting-rights-with-vbm/</ref>

title: Marc Elias
added: Ahead of the 2020 Election and amid the [[Coronavirus pandemic]], Elias has filed dozens of lawsuits to expand voter access. [18] [19] He coined the term “four pillars” [20], referring to four key components to protecting voting by mail: providing prepaid postage, counting mail-in ballots as long as they’re postmarked on or before Election Day; reformed signature matching laws; and allowing local groups to help collect and deliver voted, sealed ballots. [21]
